2.73.text: COMM: US explorer Scott Cassell has seen his

5.19.text:
homemade submarine survive its maiden dive
in Malaysia.

8.34.text: The 3,000 pound vessel can operate at depths

11.96.text:
up to 500 feet, but during its test drive
off the coat of Tioman Island, Scott and his

19.64.text: The sub had once been a rusting steel hole

22.36.text:
found discarded in a California back garden.
He set about retro fitting it with engineering

28.06.text:
colleague Scott Read, using mostly recycled
materials.

31.52.text: Now complete after several years of safety

34.55.text:
tweaks, it runs entirely on electricity, making
it one of the most eco-friendly submarines

40.68.text: It is kitted out with three external cameras

43.55.text:
along its fourteen foot exterior to help observe
underwater wildlife.

47.38.text: Scott eventually plans to deploy the deep

50.50.text: diving sub on a marine study trip around Malaysia.
